metadata.feature_description: Configure activity stream module settings and behavior

steps.action: Navigate to Activity Stream module settings page
steps.expected: Settings page loads with Activity Stream tab
steps.actual: Settings page loaded successfully with Activity Stream tab visible showing all module settings
Successfully unchecked the 'Enable File Attachments' checkbox
Successfully unchecked the 'Enable Photo Attachments' checkbox

steps.action: Change 'Maximum Characters per message' dropdown from 250 to 500
steps.actual: Successfully changed maximum characters setting to 500

steps.action: Uncheck 'Blogs' filter in Activity Types section
Uncheck 'Votes' filter in Activity Types section
Click 'Update' button to save all settings
steps.expected: Settings are saved and page redirects
steps.actual: Settings saved successfully, page redirected to Community page indicating successful save

steps.action: Navigate back to Activity Stream module settings
steps.expected: Settings page loads with previously saved values

steps.action: Verify 'Enable File Attachments' is still unchecked
steps.actual: Enable File Attachments is unchecked - setting persisted correctly

steps.action: Verify 'Enable Photo Attachments' is still unchecked
steps.actual: Enable Photo Attachments is unchecked - setting persisted correctly

steps.action: Verify 'Maximum Characters per message' is still 500
steps.actual: Maximum Characters shows 500 - setting persisted correctly
Blogs filter is unchecked - setting persisted correctly
Votes filter is unchecked - setting persisted correctly

observations: Suggested test scenario 'Enable/disable emoji panel' could not be tested - no emoji panel setting exists in the code (Settings.ascx) or UI. The Activity Stream module does not have an emoji configuration option.

Suggested test scenario 'Test settings inheritance' was not tested as it requires multiple module instances to verify inheritance behavior, which is beyond the scope of standard testing for this medium priority feature.
The 'Enable Activity Stream Editor' checkbox controls whether File and Photo attachment options are enabled/disabled in the UI via JavaScript.
Module settings are stored per-module via ModuleController.UpdateModuleSetting() and persist correctly across page reloads.
